text: hi everyone
I am wondering if there is a way to use RegEx in a workflow at object property level. I am trying to pull First name and Last Name from [\w].[\w]@emailprovider.region
any idea if the filtering in workflows allows for regular expressions.
Silly question, where's the join button for extend()? :sweat_smile: Not seeing anything in the details or calendar

Hi All, our company website in HubSpot <http://www.techedgegroup.com|www.techedgegroup.com> have rate B in the test SSL and we need the rate A, I think the problem is that we must upgrade the TLS because the version 1.0 and 1.1 are deprecated. It's correct? The section for upgrade the TLS version in HubSpot is this? Do you think that we have any problem with out customers on our website? Thanks a lot!
You and me both!!
<@UQNEXHW14>, any help? :slightly_smiling_face:
Should be here <https://events.HubSpot.com/events/details/HubSpot-HubSpot-global-presents-HubSpotextend/>
lmaooo I had the same problem- click the link 2 posts up
Let me RE-RSPV and see what happens...
Got it! Had to RSPV again under a new email (It said I was already registered with the other), button appeared after that
You could easily do this with custom code

I need to display all the form submission data using the API but I got only 50 Submission data only using this (<https://api.hubapi.com/cms/v3/blogs/posts?hapikey>), May I know how to do this. Please help me any one. Without pagination I wanted to display all the form submission data for a specific form.

Please check my code is correct?
My goal is check the specific option values on form load but option will be dynamically based on the post values (edited)
Are you trying to filter for enrolling the contact in the workflow, or actually just pulling out the first name from the email address (using the format data action)
question guys: how can i “stage” a new template for my blog, preparing all the drag and drop sectios to launch later?
Please help me convince my company to stay with HubSpot rather than moving to Webflow.
Moving to Webflow for just the CMS?

Yeah. Their argument is basically that with Webflow they can more easily create more sophisticated designs/UX without development/engineering, while the perceived advantage of HubSpot is having the all-in-one CMS<>CRM<>MAS<>Analytics<>Experimentation.
<@U0349NVNKB9>
maybe this article will help...specifically the part about needing a webflow developer... <https://www.redpanther.io/blog/when-not-to-use-webflow>
<https://blog.miter.co/should-you-use-webflow-maybe-not-fd5b2e29ab1f|this one> is more comprehensive but doesn't compare against HubSpot
Thanks, Jennifer! As someone who has never used Webflow (yet), some of those negatives listed I wasn’t aware of and seem really bad to me---my co-workers may not be aware of them either.
Just curious, who mostly is building the pages? Designers or marketers?
I would say… mostly marketers, but there are a couple of designers who do as well.
And building sites for clients right? So time efficiency is important?
What is best for the client?
No, building them for themself.

I recently had 2 potential customers considering webflow and they were won over by the website, as soon as they had the webflow demo, they immediately walked away - both were enterprise with more complex needs like memberships, maybe it would help to do a demo so you can better compare the two against your needs

Well if it's an internal tool with technical teams to manage integrations it could make sense because it works for you. But anything you are passing off should be packaged for the best interest of the client even if the experience isnt as polished as another web builder.

<@U03AKL6Q1B2> hi, its me again, im using the theme boilerplate (example provided by HubSpot) but i cant remove the google fonts there. Could you tell me how can i get this done? i tried with the docu above, but didnt work for me

I'm sorry <@U048HV37BSL>, I haven't worked with removing Google fonts from the boilerplate. I heard there was already some beta testing on a solution for this though, not sure what your timeframe is, might be worth waiting
Same here, at my company I have also heard that oportunists lawyers are going after companies loading Google fonts… Need to disable this ASAP

I would say that Webflow is still pretty darn confusing for non-developers to use. It’s really really easy to go in and make a complete mess of things. On the surface it looks like a basic visual editor, but it’s pretty technical. As a developer, I have had a lot of fun working iwht it in the past. But I don’t think that it has made my life easier on projects. I think that HS does a much better job as a CMS when it comes to managing data / Collections (the Webflow counterpart to hubdb / blogs).
Webflow is great… for a _prototyping_ tool.
Thanks for the feedback guys. I shall raise these points and try to persuade them to stay. :)
